title: How to Create a Standard House in SketchUp

steps.title: Open Google SketchUp.
steps.content: Open Google SketchUp. Choose a template.

steps.title: Use the Push/Pull tool to make the rectangle 3D.
steps.content: Use the Push/Pull tool to make the rectangle 3D.

steps.title: Create another rectangle on one of the faces of the shape, preferably the long side of the rectangle.
steps.content: Create another rectangle on one of the faces of the shape, preferably the long side of the rectangle. Use the Push/Pull tool to push in the door a little. Erase the bottom line of the rectangle.

steps.title: Use the circle tool to create windows on the side of the shape.
steps.content: Use the circle tool to create windows on the side of the shape. Use the select tool to click on the circles. Click delete on your computer keyboard.

steps.title: Expand the height of the building with the Push/Pull tool.
steps.content: Expand the height of the building with the Push/Pull tool. Use the line tool to click on a place on the lines of the building. Drag the line to the midpoint of the top of the building. Click on the same spot again and then drag the line downward until you see a line that crosses the first dot to the dot that you're dragging down.

steps.title: Use the Push/Pull tool to push back the lines until you see the word offset.
steps.content: Use the Push/Pull tool to push back the lines until you see the word offset.

steps.title: Click on Windows and then Materials.
steps.content: Click on Windows and then Materials. Use Brick and Cladding and then Roofing to finish the building.
